course.subject: HART
course.name: Introduction to Chinese Calligraphy
course.description: This is an introductory course on Chinese calligraphy. It will analyze the emergence of calligraphic styles in different dynasties and introduce the masterpieces of some renowned calligraphers. Students will study the history, development and theories of Chinese calligraphy, appreciate the beauty of this art, and learn some basic skills in writing Chinese calligraphy. Those interested in furthering the calligraphic skills and gaining hands-on experience with this art form may enroll in a separate non-credit co-curricular course.

reviews.author: haha:)
reviews.title: Heavy workload but good grade
reviews.comment_content:
The entire course focuses on Kaishu楷書 and is taught in Cantonese. The characters we learnt are all based on Professor Chan's book. And he also introduced a lot of calligraphy-related knowledge and showed his own collection.

Although I found this course with a heavy workload, I did learn a lot of skills from it. If you're interested in Chinese calligraphy, you can really consider this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Chan is very knowledgeable and willing to answer your questions patiently.
But if you are not interested in calligraphy or history, you may fall asleep easily in his class, especially after lunch.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance:  20/20
HW: 20/20(All done) + 27/30(Quality)
Test(Poem + Your name): 23/30
(The test content is received at the beginning of the course and you can practice on your own before the actual exam date.)

Final grade = A
(Quite surprised as I don't think my work is beautiful.)
(I think if you have done all the homework and were recognized by the professor, you may be pretty satisfied with the grades.)
reviews.comment_workload:
VERY VERY VERY HEAVY!!!
We had to write 16 characters every week.
Professor Chan's standard is high. If your work didn't meet his requirement, you have to redo it again and again until he said you pass. This can cause you to accumulate weeks of work and then you will be very stressed.

reviews.author: LMF
reviews.title: TOOOOO HEAVY WORKLOAD
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly teaches about the techniques of 楷書
and in the last few lessons, you will learn about different 書體's history and brief techniques.
If you are passionated in Chinese words/calligraphy, go ahead~
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Chan is a professional and experienced Chinese calligraphy teacher.
His teachings are really detailed, but he is quite harsh, which always requires us to redo our work ( which actually pushes us to have better techniques )
Mr Chan is a humorous teacher btw:)
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 20%
HW 20%
FInal ( on the last lesson): 60%

Once again, If you are passionated in Chinese words/calligraphy, and you think this course is worth to spend time on, you must get good grade lor.
reviews.comment_workload:
VERY HEAVY WORKLOAD tho it is just a 1-cred course.
Homework will be assigned every week, while they are so time-consuming!

feeling frustrated af sometimes as I have to re-do the homework for few times:( ( I enjoy writing Chinese calligraphy tho lol)

I even couldnt count how much time I spent on this course in this semester :((((((

reviews.author: nkkey
reviews.title: Dr. Chan is a chatterbox
reviews.comment_content:
臨習/參考碑帖

1. 《陳用楷書部件字帖》
2. 《陳用臨王居士磚塔銘》
3. 《王居士磚塔銘》
4. 《褚遂良雁塔聖教序》
5. 吉林出版集團《碑帖珍品臨摹本:王羲之蘭亭序》
6. 《十七帖》
7. 安徽美術出版社《歷代碑帖精粹:漢禮器碑》
8. 上海辭書出版社出版《歷代拓本精華24──泰山刻石》
9. 《毛公鼎》
10. 《芝罘刻石》

其實主要都係跟佢自己出嘅一份字帖黎寫

不過佢都會俾我地了解好多其他有名書法作品同埋書法家
中國歷史 紙墨筆硯等等
但講硯台又會講到咩化學物質（好詳細 XD 都好睇佢想講啲咩

因為呢啲都唔會考 淨係考寫字 所以我都prefer教寫字多啲
不過都有人鍾意聽同埋問問題嘅
reviews.comment_teaching:
課堂係以廣東話進行所以用中文算

陳博士真係超級講得 每堂課都要吹下佢嘅威水史
吹都唔係問題 仲要係吹足半堂
去到就黎落堂先開始教我地點樣寫 根本就唔夠時間寫比佢睇
仲要要求勁高寫到同佢幾乎一模一樣先收貨
reviews.comment_grading:
1 parti 20%  
2 pass左嘅功課 20%
3 mt 30%
4 final 30%

final要默一首詩 唔可以睇佢字帖

我俾左唔少心機練習 最尾A-
不過對於1cre嘅堂黎講真係唔係好值得
除非你本身有底同埋得閒得滯 可以試下當係“relax”嘅

btw 小tips
陳博士鍾意有人擦佢鞋 如果你呢方面真係好叻
真係會加分架！不過我就不了
reviews.comment_workload:
不能再大了！

每個禮拜起碼都要寫幾個鐘先寫到一份功課（張紙寫錯一隻字都唔得。。。
同埋佢拒收率真係好高 試過一次班裡面得一兩個過到關。。。

reviews.author: Jsmster1681
reviews.title: Great for calligraphy lovers
reviews.comment_content:
The content is similar to what other reviews say so I will not repeat it.  But it is worth mentioning that assignment for style outside of 楷書 was canceled as Dr. Chan thinks that it is not possible to learn much for one style with only a lesson or two.

Also, the characters that has no reference from the copybook is canceled from the 楷書 assignments.

These policies lowers the workload and probably will be continued for the next fall course.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Chan is a skilled artist with solid experience in teaching. I would say his teaching is a bit old-school but it is nothing wrong for a calligraphy teacher. He would patiently demonstrate to you and point out your mistake one on one(Although the a mount of time may vary from student to student).
reviews.comment_grading: Actually it is not harsh at all, I have only manage to hand over 4/10 assignments and practice for only 8 hours or so for the final quiz and still manage to get B-. If it is other course I would probably just get an F.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is sooooo high. There is one assignment for each lesson and each assignment consists of 16 Chinese characters. You will have to spend 4+ hours each week to practice. And similar to other review, you will have to have to rewrite your assignment if he is not satisfied.

In fact, even the lecturer said there is too much content to teach as he will only teach 4 characters for each lesson of his private calligraphy class. However, I must be fair that such a high workload is given as the lecturer really wants us be good at calligraphy and that requires tons of practice.

The final quiz consists of 8 characters for the copybook and 16 character from the poem 霽雪(no copybook for reference) + your Chinese name. This could also take a lot of time to practice if you want to get a good grade.

reviews.author: Carlar
reviews.title: 要求高嘅導論堂
reviews.comment_content:
課程大綱：
1. 介紹工具、主要講保養同使用毛筆、講吓邊度買（一定唔係街邊普通文具店）
2-4. 楷書基本筆法 e.g. 點 橫 勾、同埋書法筆順同平時寫字可以有唔同
4-7. 臨摹《王居士塼塔銘》本書係佢自己臨王居士塼塔銘，然後我哋臨佢本書。

之後基本上講吓書法史同出名嘅書法作品 e.g. 王羲之蘭亭序 積雪凝寒帖 上堂都會臨 但係都唔要求我哋臨得好 都係玩吓就算 但係佢本王居士塼塔銘就一定要臨得好
8. 行書 9. 草書 10. 隸書 11. 小篆 12. 大篆、書法的幅式、題款與蓋印
13. 測驗（即係final）
reviews.comment_teaching: 講野算風趣 上堂會講住嘢示範點寫 成日會帶啲作品同佢啲收藏show吓俾我哋睇 每堂佢講得七七八八就俾我哋練吓 順便佢周圍行睇吓我哋啲手勢點 佢份人幾nice 你問佢嘢佢好歡迎
reviews.comment_grading:
上堂一定要print講義 soft-copy佢唔like
除咗第一堂，其他堂都要交寫好嘅功課 有寫就有分 final好重要 佢會俾成堂你寫 冇得賴唔夠時間 所以之前練得夠 就輕鬆

出席 20%︰
遲到或未携足講義扣1%，無故缺席扣 2%。

習作 20%

測驗 30%+30%：
堂上背臨《王居士塼塔銘》 入邊十六字
書寫元好問《家山歸夢圖》三首之三 加寸楷姓名及「書」字
reviews.comment_workload:
1cred 黎講要有收穫嘅話一定要俾多好多時間 一星期一堂 仲要花時間練字 唔練final炒硬 因為佢對我哋臨佢本王居士塼塔銘要求幾高吓

對書法同書法史有興趣 又肯花時間練字先好入，唔係就冇意思

reviews.author: csheep
reviews.comment_content: 本課程乃中國書法的入門課，透過講解及分析歷朝書法名作和書家，讓同學了解中國書法的歷 史發展、理論及不同書法家的風格，提高對書法的欣賞能力。此外，同學將學習各種書體，掌 握基本的書寫技巧，體驗中國傳統書法的精神。
reviews.comment_teaching:
Chan Yung is a very nice teacher. He will individually check your assignments every lecture and give you comments for improvement on your calligraphies works. His lectures are not boring as he will use half of the lecture time to demonstrate how to write different styles of calligraphies and give you some time for practicing.
Only students who can speak and understand Cantonese are available to take this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
出席 (遲到每次扣1%，無故缺席扣 2%) 20%
習作(10份) 20%
Final (背臨王居士塼塔銘十六字& 書寫擔當詩并加寸楷姓名) 60%

Grading is fair if your handwriting is not bad.
Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Quite heavy workload. Every lecture require at least one to two assignments. But for those who like calligraphies then the workload will be fine for them.

reviews.author: sasannnl
reviews.comment_content:
The syllabus has been attached. You can take a look by yourself.

It is noteworthy that you are needed to spend more than $100 to purchase the stationery, either from the bookstore or the professor.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is conducted in Cantonese. It doesn't matter if you can't speak Cantonese, thus some mainland students registered in this course as well. And most of the time the professor will talk about the culture and history of Chinese Calligraphy. And 15-20 minutes will be given to students to practice on their own.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is too subjective. And the key to get a good grade is to show your good attitude towards the professor and the calligraphy. For example, you can actively attend some talk organized by the professor to show your zealousness and leave him a good impression. Also, you can constantly ask him some questions about calligraphy. Therefore, "擦鞋仔“ can probably get good grades haha.

20% Attendance. Nearly all students get full marks in this part.
20% Assignment. Nearly all students get full marks in this part. Just upload all your stamped assignments by the end of the semester.
60% Final exam. Held on the last class. Significant part that can totally affect your grade. For students who have learned the calligraphy before, it will be easier for them t get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is super HEAVYYYY!!!!!
It's just a one-credit course, however, besides the 2-hour lecture time, you still need to spend several hours practicing and finishing the homework. The quality of homework doesn't affect the grade, but all of them should be assessed and stamped by the professor, and you will be required to do it again if he is not satisfied.

reviews.author: SY :)
reviews.title: Interesting but a lot of hard work
reviews.comment_content:
Content is interesting, 陳用老師 demonstrates and gives a lot of extra information about the histories and cultural stuff of varies 書體. So if you are a good story listener you will be happy about that.
He also did a lot of demonstrations in class where you can learn through observation.
As time is limited for so many 書體，you won't get too deep into each but it is ok for an introductory course.
In my term the course is conducted in Cantonese but he can understand PTH too so if you are a mainland student who can understand but can't speak Cantonese very well you can still apply it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is a very experienced artist. He demonstrate most content very clearly. Sometimes he is clumsy but if you don't understand you are always free to ask him.
He is very strict though. He might require you to redo your assignments if they are not good enough. But that is fine because this is art and thats the way he pushes us to get better.
He is sometimes very proud and boasts his achievements, just ignore him :D
reviews.comment_grading:
Overall students get ok-ish grade. nor sure about the grading of other art courses.
For this course, grading doesn't depend only on the results but he also asses you by your attitude or if you are hard working
So don't try to "hea" him but pay attention to his instructions and comments even though they seems not to be so important.
reviews.comment_workload:
This is a very high work load course, but its art so its normal that the credit doesn't reflects how much work.
Each lesson you receive assignments and they usually consumes a lot of time as you need plenty of time to prepare ink and wash brushes and stuff like that.
Worth though. If you are interested, and pay a lot of hard work you are going to really gain something from this course (and for life) and get satisfactory benefits.
